overview: This subject introduces Teacher Candidates to the theory and practice of teaching English. Building on Teacher Candidate’s knowledge of the theory and practice of teaching, this subject provides Teacher Candidates with an introduction to the content pedagogical knowledge and skills required to effectively teach this area. This subject will provide Teacher Candidates with a foundation to teach at the Year 7 and 8 level in English within school contexts.

Teacher Candidates will be supported to develop knowledge and skills related to English within the context of the Australian/Victorian Curricula and Frameworks, best practice pedagogy and assessment, and their application in classrooms. They are encouraged to adapt and apply this knowledge in lesson planning, including the selection and integration of strategies and resources, including ICT. The assessment tasks in this subject will support the development of Teacher Candidates understanding of content and pedagogical knowledge, along with specific skills in resourcing and delivering learning programs.
intended learning outcomes: Demonstrate subject and pedagogical content knowledge, including the teaching of key concepts, knowledge and skills of the learning area for Years 7 to 8.
Plan, structure and sequence learning programs, integrating knowledge of student learning, curriculum and content selection, assessment, and reporting.
Select and integrate teaching strategies and resources, including ICT, to meet the specific needs of students from diverse backgrounds, and to engage students in their learning.
non-allowed subjects: EDUC90437 Learning Area English 1 (no longer offered)

assessments.description: Report: Written report on content pedagogical knowledge. 2000 words
Planning Document: Selection of a key resource and development of a teaching sequence. 3000 words (equivalent)

Attendance. Hurdle requirement:. A minimum of 80% attendance at, or engagement with, all sessions identified as contact hours (may include lectures, tutorials, seminars and workshops, both synchronous and asynchronous).

Semester 2.Contact hours: 24 hours (16 hours of on campus classes and 8 hours of asynchronous online activities)

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
